oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ralph Emery Interviews George Jones - Parts 1, 2 and 3
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording is from Ralph Emery's (entertainer) interview of George Jones (performer) for the Ralph Emery Show. Tape labeled parts 1, 2 and 3. Recording is from October 17, 1984.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ralph Emery; George Jones
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) George Jones radio spot for the Ralph Emery Show -- (00:18) Ralph Emery introduces Jones, and the two describe the beginning of "The Race is On" -- (01:07) Jones describes the Nashville influence on his ability to acquire songs when describing "She's My Rock" -- (02:47) Emery and Jones discuss, where Jones lives, 'Jones Country' -- (04:06) Emery recalls how other disc jockeys would call Jones: Rider Texas Flash -- (07:39) Emery inquires about Jones' success with "He Stopped Lovin' Her Today" -- (10:19) Emery invites Jones to discuss 'Jones Country,' and the artists they were able to acquire to perform -- (14:37) Emery discusses how Jones was at the show in his rare free time -- (16:25) Emery does his outro commercial spots and says goodbye -- (16:55) Emery introduces Exile's "Give Me One More Chance" -- (17:17) Emery and Jones discuss Jones' time in the Marine Corps -- (21:22) Walk Through This World With Me [Excerpt] (George Jones) -- (21:40) Emery asks Jones who his favorite country artist is; Jones say his favorites are Connie Smith and Merle Haggard -- (23:59) Emery invites Jones to reflect on his favorite Smith tracks -- (26:07) Emery and Jones discuss the number of female artists Jones worked with on 'Ladies Choice' -- (29:39) Jones discusses his enjoyment he gets from activities such as bowling and fishing -- (31:24) Emery inquires about Jones' album cover featuring Jones as a child -- (34:31) Emery performs a commercial outro and says goodbye to the audience -- (35:02) Emery introduces Jones and "Goodbye Heartache" -- (35:30) "Nothing Ever Hurt Me Half as Losing You" is told by Jones to be a difficult record to perform -- (36:17) Emery asks Jones about his perception of the media's take on himself -- (38:56) Emery introduces Jones' lengthy career and his friendship to Marty Robbins -- (40:56) Emery and Jones recall the time Johnny Rodriguez was helped by Jones -- (44:26) Emery inquires about Jones' wife Nancy Jones and when they met -- (45:42) Emery invites Nancy to discuss how she and George met -- (48:51) Emery inquires Nancy about the Jones' wedding and George's habits -- (50:58) Jones jokes about Emery becoming his manager -- (52:08) Emery recalls about the first time he heard of Jones, and Jones recalls how he and Johnny Cash started their careers at the same time -- (53:55) Emery inquires about the duration of 'Thumper' Jones -- (54:45) Emery performs a commercial outro and says goodbye to the audience
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Emery, Ralph; Jones, George; Jones, George, 1931-2013;
